statement.title: Problem Description
statement.content: Some 1×2 dominoes are placed on a plane. Each dominoe is placed either horizontally or vertically. It's guaranteed the dominoes in the same direction are not overlapped, but horizontal and vertical dominoes may overlap with each other. You task is to remove some dominoes, so that the remaining dominoes do not overlap with each other. Now, tell me the maximum number of dominoes left on the board.

statement.title: Input
statement.content:
There are multiple input cases.
　　The first line of each case are 2 integers: n(1 <= n <= 1000), m(1 <= m <= 1000), indicating the number of horizontal and vertical dominoes.
Then n lines follow, each line contains 2 integers x (0 <= x <= 100) and y (0 <= y <= 100), indicating the position of a horizontal dominoe. The dominoe occupies the grids of (x, y) and (x + 1, y).
　　Then m lines follow, each line contains 2 integers x (0 <= x <= 100) and y (0 <= y <= 100), indicating the position of a horizontal dominoe. The dominoe occupies the grids of (x, y) and (x, y + 1).
　　Input ends with n = 0 and m = 0.

statement.title: Output
statement.content: For each test case, output the maximum number of remaining dominoes in a line.
